description: Minor Material Amendment (S.73) to vary condition 2 (approved plans) pursuant to planning permission 212190FUL dated 28/05/2021 for 'Construction of a two-storey detached dwelling house'.  The proposed amendments include alterations to the fenestration and rooflights, removal of the chimney, alteration to the roof profile, the relocation of the rear dormer and alterations to the front lighting detail (Retrospective application)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers and documents: 100_01 Rev C (GA_Proposed Block Plan), 100_02 Rev C (GA_Proposed Site Plan), 100_03 Rev B (GA_Proposed Ground Floor Plan), 100), 04 Rev C (GA_Proposed First Floor Plan), 100_05 Rev C (GA_Proposed Second Floor Plan), 100_06 Rev F (GA_Proposed Exterior Elevation), 100_07 Rev F (GA_Proposed Rear Elevation), 100_08 Rev E (GA_Proposed Right & Left Elevation), 100_09 Rev X (GA_All Existing Elevations) and 100_10 Rev C (GA_Existing & Proposed Roof Plan).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The external materials and finishes for all external surfaces (including hardstanding and boundary treatments) of the development hereby approved shall be in accordance with those described in the 'Material Finishes of Property & Site Document' prepared by Next Chapter Design, received 02.06.2021, as discharged by application reference 214002CND dated 15 July 2021.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D4 and D5 of the London Plan (2021) and section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - F of Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment to that order) no outbuildings, extensions or alterations shall be carried out at the dwellinghouse hereby approved without the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area, and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D4, D5 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Two cycle parking facilities shall be implemented and operational before the first use of any part of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. A minimum of two (2) cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover and lockable compound.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The first-floor windows in the side elevations shall be fully obscure glazed and fixed shut unless the openable part of the windows is at least 1.7m above the internal floor level of the room the window serves.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with Policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012) and Policies D4 and D5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The insulation of the building envelope of the development hereby approved, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be in accordance with those described in the 'Aran Acoustics BS8233 Noise Assessment' by Next Chapter Design Ltd, dated 220 August 2021, as discharged by application reference 214324CND dated 1 September 2021.

Reason: Because the site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (60 dB) and in the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration' and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the details described in the 'Method Statement & Insulation of Building and Method Statement & Insulation of Building V2' by Next Chapter Design, as discharged by application 214325CND dated 12 July 2021.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site and occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D5 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Any boiler installed in the dwelling shall be an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).
